item.title: Report X-2025050192
item.description:
Report X-2025050192

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: MOUNT AIRY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver called to report that a pallet of metal pails of hazardous material was refused by a customer because it was leaking. The driver advised it appeared the pails were packed too tightly together causing the tops to pop off some of them causing a 1 foot puddle on the trailer floor. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation and not to move until after clean up is complete.

item.title: Report E-2025040542
item.description:
Report E-2025040542

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:34 EDT on 3/25, XPO-NCH contacted ERTS to report an incident. A 55lb nylon bag of Aluminum Chloride was punctured by a forklift at LHO but did not spill. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who chose to overpack the container into a poly drum using terminal-issued PPE. ERTS generated waste ID: 231620-1

item.title: Report E-2025050024
item.description:
Report E-2025050024

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: WALLACE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver hooked hose to fitting on the ULSD tank. Then hooked hose to the trailer and pulled the handle. He saw ULSD running on the pavement and shut it off. He had 2 hoses on the ground and realized he hooked the wrong hose to the trailer. The hose he hooked to the trailer was not connected to anything on the other end. This caused a spill of 20 gallons of ULSD. CDG managed the cleanup.
